reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pictures and the website of the hotel are a little misleading. I was disapointed as I imagined this to be part of a nice chain of hotels......The good points: the hotel is 2 min walk from Plaza Universitat (metro), just in front of a bus stop and 10 min walk from Rambla. The bathroom was very clean, spacious, the bed was comfortable and very clean as well. Breakfast was also nice. However.....the bad points: The room itself was really really tiny. The common areas of the hotel are really dodgy. The reception area looks bad and the receptionists were nice, but not that helpful.
reviews.title: Hotel Gran Ronda, ok, but......
Great location,beware of rooms facing the inside!
reviews.text: Overall it was an OK experience for a couple of nights at a reasonable price, but I will try and find another hotel next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok this is a hard one for me...We went there for a weekend and we chose it after reading all these good reviews at TA.I'll try and be objective - you'll what I mean.
reviews.title: Will Return to the Apsis Gran Ronda

likes.disliked: — Could be more hot dishes at breakfast.

reviews.title: stayed longer than expected because it was sooooo good!
reviews.text: The location is great!Couldn't have been better!We walked everywhere,it is very central and its safe to walk around it at night.

Staff where so and so.They were nice but didn't really care when we comlained.We had a problem with our sink the first night.It was full of water and we couldn't wash ourselves so I called reception and the guy said he is on his own so can't do anything but will try to get someone..Went down a bit later to talk to him to complain about our room and in the end he said to me: Do you still want me to call someone to fix the sink?.....
reviews.title: Excellent apart from one irritation

reviews.text: I stayed at the Gran Ronda for one night in early November 2007. I have to say an absolutely fantastic hotel. Rooms are very modern with superb bathroom facilities and flat screen tv. The room also has a mini safe which comes in handy. The staff are also very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Hotel-Shame about the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downsides are that the street outside the hotel is very sleazy at night. Don't let this put you off as many streets in Barcelona are like this.
reviews.title: Great location, good value

likes.liked: — location, value, modern room, large bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Watch out for the lowlife pickpockets, especially on the metro. Keep an eye on your bag/wallet at all times and you will be ok. I was only in Barcelona 6 hours and my wallet was stolen from my pocket despite only having my hand out my pocket for all of 30 seconds on the metro.
reviews.title: Gran Ronda Good Location

reviews.text: All in all, great Hotel, its a shame my experience of Barcelona in general has deterred me from visiting ever again.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, good location!

likes.liked: — Nice bathroom and good size room.
likes.disliked: — I might have liked to be closer to La Rambla.

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at Gran Ronda 3 nights and we really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Adequate Hotel
Good location and value
reviews.text: We stayed at the Gran Ronda for 3 nights during our stay in Barcelona. We paid 120 euros a night, and it was worth every penny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our rooms were very modern, with a beautiful bathroom and flat screen tv. The hotel is situated north of Placa Catalunya in the business district, and it was very close to the Universidad Metro station. We could easily walk everywhere, although we did enjoy taking the speedy train as well.
reviews.title: great location and lovely room

likes.liked: — the room with flat screen tv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel, and I hope to return one day!
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

reviews.text: I found the Gran Ronda hotel to be a lovely well located hotel in Barcelona...5 mins walk to Las Ramblas and 1 min walk to the nearest metro where you can access almost anywhere in the city... We requested a double room the morning we arrived as the website we booked on would not allow us to and we were accommodated..the room was facing out on to the street..there was no smell of drains or no noise..except the cleanin lady knocking at our door..but we did sleep in late!! The staff were helpful,especiallythe lady who checked us in..we didnt get breakfast as i thought it was a little pricy,but ate out instead.. all in all a lovely stay in the Gran Ronda :)
reviews.title: Expensive & smelt of drains

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights with my Boyfriend in Jan 2007. As soon as we checked in we were impressed, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was one of the best we have stayed in!

likes.disliked: — the rooms with the internal windows

reviews.title: Good Value, close to Ramblas.
reviews.text: Lovely buffett breakfast, (check when booking if included).

I must warn you though if you are staying longer than a weekend ask for a room with an external window as they also have rooms with internal windows facing the lifts, these are dark and quite small.We asked to swap as we were there for a week, had to wait until the following day but staff were helpful and happy to do so. Rooms very clean, spotless bathrooms, comfortable bed.Would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: ideal location
Excellent, position, room,staff and breakfast...GREAT
reviews.text: Hotel 2 minutes walk from Universitat metro and 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas. It is in a quiet safe area. The hotel itself was with very 'hotel' standard rooms, very new with a powerful shower and lovely sheets on the beds! I felt it was good value for money and would perhaps stay there again. Staff helpful and excellent breakfast. My only complaints were that the beds were twins pushed together to make a double - easy to fall down the middle! Also our ground floor 'balcony' looked more like somewhere you would put your bins.
